meanings.definition: To add a prefix or prefixes to a word or phrase.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys prefixing her name with 'Dr.' to show her accomplishment.
meanings.sent2: The student is prefixing 'un-' to the word 'happy' to change its meaning.
meanings.sent3: John kept prefixing 'super-' to random words, creating silly combinations.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acts as a prefixing force, changing the atmosphere around her.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes prefixing color to the canvas brought the painting to life.

meanings.definition: To place or attach at the beginning.
meanings.sent1: He is prefixing the title 'Mr.' before his name on the form.
meanings.sent2: The chef is prefixing the garnish on top of the dish to enhance its presentation.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel kept prefixing acorns at the entrance of its burrow, confusing its neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The morning dew prefixing the petals of the flower made it sparkle like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The architect is prefixing the grand entrance to the building, making it stand out among the rest.
